Module com.example.finalprojectwithjavafx
Package gameobjects.Navigator

Class Navigator

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameobjects.Navigator.Navigator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Savable
    public class Navigator
extends java.lang.Object
implements Savable
    Keeps track of the current player, their location on the current map, and which map (out of a group of maps) they are one. Saves and loads games. Implements Savable interface.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private int column
      The coordinates of the player on the map, index 0.
      private MapBase currentMap
      The map currently occupied by the player.
      private TileBase currentTile
      Tile on the current map the player occupies.
      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​MapBase> mapCollection
      A hashmap of the maps in the game, each map's in the set uses its hashcode as a key.
      boolean newGame
      Boolean indicating whether the game is a new game built in the program, or one that has been loaded from a text file.
      private Entity player
      The current player.
      private int row
      The coordinates of the player on the map, index 0.
      private static Navigator uniqueInstance
      Single instance of the navigator in use.

        The map currently occupied by the player.

      • mapCollection

        private final java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​MapBase> mapCollection
        A hashmap of the maps in the game, each map's in the set uses its hashcode as a key. Necessary for loading maps.

        Tile on the current map the player occupies.

        The coordinates of the player on the map, index 0.

        The coordinates of the player on the map, index 0.

      • player

        private Entity player
        The current player.

      • newGame

        public boolean newGame
        Boolean indicating whether the game is a new game built in the program, or one that has been loaded from a text file. Necessary in other parts of the program.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Navigator

        private Navigator​(Entity player,
                  java.util.ArrayList<MapBase> mapSet,
                  MapBase currentMap,
                  int playerRowPosition,
                  int playerColumnPosition)
        Defines Navigator, called in setState method.
        Parameters:
        player - - Entity to represent user.
        mapSet - - set of maps to be included in this instance of the game.
        playerColumnPosition - - horizontal coordinate of tile on tile matrix
        playerRowPosition - - vertical coordinate of tile on tile matrix

    • Method Detail

      • setState

        public static Navigator setState​(Entity player,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<MapBase> mapSet,
                                 MapBase currentMap,
                                 int column,
                                 int row)
        Sets the state of the navigator.
        Parameters:
        player - - the player.
        mapSet - - the set of maps to be used in this instance of the game.
        currentMap - - the map the player occupies.
        column - - column the player occupies.
        row - - row the player occupies.
        Returns:
        Navigator.uniqueInstance.

      • getInstance

        public static Navigator getInstance()
        Get the current instance of the navigator, if one has not been defined yet, define a one with null and dummy values.
        Returns:
        Navigator.uniqueInstance

        Parameters:

        public int[] getPosition()
        Returns:
        an array of the row and column which define the players position.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition​(int newRow,
                        int newColumn)
        Column and row are index 0. Places player in the new position on the map.
        Parameters:
        newRow - - row of the position player is moving to.
        newColumn - - column of the new position player is moving to.

      • moveTile

        public MoveKey moveTile​(int row,
                        int column)
        Move to tile at new coordinates, returns MoveKey enum which is processed by other functions, (e.g., if it returns "tile-occupied" MoveKey, another method will determine is that occupant is an enemy and respond accordingly)
        Parameters:
        row - - new row position, cannot be more than one tile away from current row.
        column - - new column position, cannot be more than one tile away from current column. returns MoveKey, which is handled by the scene.

      • forceMove

        public void forceMove​(int row,
                      int column)
        Move player to new tile, does not have any checks (e.g., will move player to tile regardless of range of the new tile or if it has an occupant). !!! USE WITH CAUTION !!!
        Parameters:
        row - - row of tile to move to.
        column - - column of tile to move to.

      • saveInstance

        public void saveInstance​(java.lang.String saveFileName)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the state of the game to a file named saveFileName. Saves the maps which the games use. After this, the player is saved, then the hashcode of the map, and then the players position on the current map. FileWriter opened and closed in method.
        Parameters:
        saveFileName - - name of the file to be saves, method appends a ".txt" suffix if it is not included.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - due to FileWriter.

      • saveInstance

        public void saveInstance​(java.io.FileWriter saveFile)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Other than the parameter, identical to saveFile(String).
        Specified by:
        saveInstance in interface Savable
        Parameters:
        saveFile - - instance of FileWriter, if this method is used it must be closed outside the method.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - due to FileWriter.

      • loadGame

        public void loadGame​(java.lang.String fileName)
              throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Loads an instance of the game previously saved by saveInstance method.
        Parameters:
        fileName - - name of file being loaded.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - - if file is not found.

      • reset

        private static void reset()
        Sets values in navigator to values that are either null, or to placeholder values.

        private java.lang.String appendTxtSuffix​(java.lang.String fileName)
        To be used when feeding a method a txt file name, if there is no txt suffix at the end of the file, appends it to fileName.
        Parameters:
        fileName - - name of file.
